intro: Spermacoce hebecarpa, commonly known as the hairy false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
